Back to School Task Force - Hello Frazier Family, I hope this post finds you healthy and well. As an informational update I want you to know that the Frazier SD is meeting regularly to formulate a plan with how to best open our schools for the 2020/2021 school year. The schools are currently planning to open on August 24, 2020.

District Administrators are meeting with teachers, parents, school board members, nurses and several Frazier students to formulate a plan on what must take place during our opening. We are considering both the guidance of the PA Department of Education and Gov. Wolf's PA State recommendations as we formulate our plan.

Dr. Henderson, FSD Superintendent, continues to meet and collaborate with surrounding school districts as well as state officials in order to help develop a back to school plan that will be safe for everybody. I will do my best to keep you up to date as the plan comes together.

Have a safe and happy holiday,

Mr. Turek

Don’t Wait! Vaccinate!

Children in ALL grades (K-12) need the following immunizations for attendance:

• 4 doses of tetanus, diphtheria, and acellular pertussis* (1 dose on or after 4th birthday)
• 4 doses of polio (4th dose on or after 4th birthday and at least 6 months after previous dose given)
• 2 doses of measles, mumps, and rubella**
• 3 doses of hepatitis B
• 2 doses of varicella (chickenpox) or evidence of immunity

Additional vaccinations needed for 7th through 12th grade.

* Usually given as DTaP or DTP or DT or Td
** Usually given as MMR
